answers.answer: It's hard to say, i doubt anything would work for you naturally yet as you're not quite term yet. I was induced at 38 weeks for my last one, and i wasn't even dilated at all, and my cervix was still tightly closed and high up. I needed the gel to bring on the contractions, and my labour lasted 5 & a half hours. Do you know if you're dilated at all yet?

It may or may not help.. it wouldn't hurt though.  It really needed to be started at week 35-36. Raspberry leaf tea and primrose oil helps labor but it wont start it.. try LOTS of sex. But if you haven't had any labor symptoms its probably not going to happen. Why you getting induced?

It may or may not help.. it wouldn't hurt though.  It really needed to be started at week 35-36. Raspberry leaf tea and primrose oil helps labor but it wont start it.. try LOTS of sex. But if you haven't had any labor symptoms its probably not going to happen. Why you getting induced?

Don't know about being dilated yet have appointment Monday so may check then.baby has dropped really low now and been having quite alot of bh that are getting worse.im hoping I've started to.dilate at least a bit. Getting induces because I have gestational diabetes so baby getting quite large and I also have had problems with high blood pressure.

Im being induced exactly a week after you.-&had my cervix checked on Wed. iWas 1-2 centimeters dilalated-&started losing my mucus plug last night.. My Dr said since im dialating, thatll make things a lil' easier. So best of luck! Hope your dialated:)!
I was dialated to 3 at 80 percent for 3 weeks beforebeing induced and it didnt help at all at least i dont think it did. It still hurt like crazy!
Thanks girls. I thought if im a lil dilated then may b less time in hosp doing it. Hopefully find out tomorrow if I've made any progress and get my date for the week =)

question: Hey ladies im 37+3 due to.be induced at 38 weeks . But I've been thinking do you think it would make labour easier if I try all this herb tea and what ever else first ? Even if all the walking helps soften up cervix. Do you think it would mAke the induction go easier if I help it along even if I dnt go in.to full labour myself?
title: inducing/ natural labour
